title: FIELDS view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
This Information Schema view displays a row for each field in a
structured OBJECT type and a row for the key and value in a
MAP in an object (a column in a table) in the specified (or current) database.
For MAPs, the view contains separate rows for the key and value.
Each row describes the type of the element in the structured ARRAY.
Database that contains the object that uses this OBJECT or MAP type.
Schema that contains the object that uses this OBJECT or MAP type.
Name of the object that uses this OBJECT or MAP type (e.g. name of a table).
Type of the object that uses this OBJECT or MAP type:
Type identifier. Use this to join on:
The DTD_IDENTIFIER column in the COLUMNS view.
The DTD_IDENTIFIER column in the ELEMENT_TYPES view (for nested types).
The DTD_IDENTIFIER column in this view (for nested types).
For structured OBJECTs, the name of the key.
For MAPs, KEY for the key or VALUE for the value.
The ordinal position of the key in the OBJECT or MAP. The position is 1-based.
For MAPs, the ordinal position of the key is 1, and the ordinal position of the value is 2.
Data type of the value (for OBJECTs) or the key or value (for MAPs).
Maximum length in characters of string keys or values.
Maximum length in bytes of string keys or values.
Numeric precision of numeric keys or values.
Radix of precision of numeric keys or values.
Scale of numeric keys or values.
The collation specification for this keys or values.
Maximum cardinality. Currently, this is always set to NULL.
Nested type identifier. Use this to join on:
The COLLECTION_TYPE_IDENTIFIER column in the ELEMENT_TYPES view.
The ROW_IDENTIFIER column in this view (for nested types).
The view only displays objects for which the current role for the session has been granted access privileges.

The view does not honor the MANAGE GRANTS privilege and consequently may show less information compared to the
SHOW COLUMNS command when both are executed by a user who holds the MANAGE GRANTS privilege.
